SKIMS is looking for a digital analytics leader to own & optimize data governance across our digital commerce platforms, driving robust web & mobile app performance insights to inform business enhancements.This individual should be a thought leader on digital analytics, privacy & industry trends (browser cookie depreciation, first party data, etc.)Reporting to the SVP of eCommerce, this individual will collaborate closely with our engineering & product teams as the in-house expert across all technical analytics topics.ResponsibilitiesCollaborate closely with digital product & engineering to implement advanced analytics & tracking capabilities across all digital properties.Responsible for data integrity by owning all web & mobile analytics data sources & tag management, continuously optimizing & auditing.Own & advance our server-side, mobile app & headless tracking set-upCollect, clean & manipulate data – use of SQL & fundamentals of data engineeringSpearhead advanced digital analytics initiatives related to identity and clickstream data.Operate as internal expert for GA4 and any other digital analytics toolsLead team in optimizing daily/weekly/monthly product insights, informing consumer journey enhancements and reporting on the subsequent performance impactGuide team focused on A/B testing & personalization efforts, instilling culture of disciplined statistical analysis.Guide team on customer journey analysis, heat mapping, session recording and user research best practicesWork closely with our technology team to ensure best practices across cookie consent management (CCPA, GDPR, etc)Key Skills And Experience8+ years of analytics experience at a relevant ecommerce businessDeep familiarity with Google Analytics, GA360, GA4, Adobe AnalyticsExperience with analytics & tracking platforms such as Segment, RudderstackDeep familiarity with tagging tools (GTM, Tealium, Adobe etc.)Experience utilizing a customer journey analysis tool (Mixpanel, Heap, Quantum Metric, Full Story etc)Significant experience utilizing data warehouse or CDP to consolidate customer profiles & utilize across owned digital channelsWell-versed in advanced statistical analysis techniques and leveraging BI tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau)Demonstrated leadership experience, willing to coach & develop team of high performersStrong desire to collaborate cross-functionally, understanding varying objectives across business functionsTo achieve our goals SKIMS is committed to employing candidates that are representative of the communities we serve. Diverse and inclusive teams have a positive impact on our products and services. They foster innovation and excellence. SKIMS believes in an environment where differences are valued and encouraged. We are committed to inclusion across race, gender, age, religion, education, identity, and experience.Salary$160-$200k$160,000 - $200,000 a yearTo achieve our goals SKIMS is committed to employing candidates that are representative of the communities we serve. Diverse and inclusive teams have a positive impact on our products and services. They foster innovation and excellence. SKIMS believes in an environment where differences are valued and encouraged. We are committed to inclusion across race, gender, age, religion, education, identity, and experience.
